Rapat Selama 13 Jam Soal Iuran BPJS Kesehatan, Hasilnya ?
06 Nov 2019, 19:09 by Lani Diana Wijaya, Ali Akhmad Noor Hidayat
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Rapat dengar pendapat antara Kementerian Kesehatan dan Komisi IX DPR mengenai besaran iuran BPJS Kesehatan yang berlangsung 13 jam, Rabu kemarin 6 November 2019 tidak menghasilkan keputusan. Dewan pun memutuskan melanjutkan rapat yang sudah berlangsung sejak 10.00 WIB hingga 23.00 WIB pada Kamis 7 November 2019.
Mulanya beberapa anggota dewan mengusulkan agar rapat dilanjutkan pada 7 November 2019.
Akan tetapi, Menteri Kesehatan Terawan Agus Putranto tak dapat hadir karena harus menemani kunjungan kerja Wakil Presiden Ma'ruf Amin.
"Kalau besok mohon maaf saya tidak bisa hadir," kata Terawan di dalam ruang rapat Komisi IX, Gedung DPR, Jakarta, Rabu malam, 6 November 2019.
Dewan kembali berargumen. Mayoritas menginginkan rapat dilanjutkan hari ini dan dihadiri Terawan. Sebab, pemerintah belum menjawab pertanyaan-pertanyaan yang diajukan dewan.
Terawan akhirnya merelakan kunjungan kerjanya. "Prioritas saya bersama Komisi IX. Besok saya akan hadir," ucap Terawan.
Wakil Ketua Komisi IX Sri Rahayu mengatakan harus ada keputusan yang menguntungkan semua pihak alias win-win solution. Dewan sepakat agar Terawan tetap dapat menjalankan tanggung jawabnya mengikuti kunjungan kerja sekaligus rapat di DPR.
Alhasil, dewan memutuskan rapat dilanjutkan hari ini pukul 19.00 WIB usai kunjungan kerja Terawan. Politikus PDIP ini mengingatkan agar pemerintah melengkapi data.
"Tolong data dilengkapi, kalau rinci lebih enak. Karena itu kita lanjutkan rapat besok pukul 19.00 tepat," ujar Sri.
Kenaikan iuran BPJS Kesehatan secara resmi diketok setelah Presiden Jokowi meneken Peraturan atau Perpres Nomor 75 Tahun 2019 tentang Perubahan atas Perpres Nomor 82 Tahun 2018 tentang Jaminan Kesehatan pada 24 Oktober lalu. Kenaikan ini berlaku untuk seluruh segmen peserta.

13 Hours Meeting on BPJS Health Contribution Problem, Results?
06 Nov 2019, 19:09 by Lani Diana Wijaya, Ali Akhmad Noor Hidayat
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - A hearing meeting between the Ministry of Health and the House of Representatives Commission IX regarding the amount of BPJS Health contributions which lasted 13 hours, Wednesday, November 6, 2019 did not produce a decision. The Board also decided to continue the meeting which had been held from 10.00 WIB until 23.00 WIB on Thursday, 7 November 2019.
Initially several board members suggested that the meeting be resumed on 7 November 2019.
However, Minister of Health Terawan Agus Putranto could not attend because he had to accompany the work visit of Vice President Ma'ruf Amin.
"If tomorrow I apologize for not being able to attend," said Terawan in the Commission IX meeting room, DPR Building, Jakarta, Wednesday night, November 6, 2019.
The council argued again. The majority wanted the meeting to continue today and to be attended by Terawan. Because the government has not answered the questions raised by the council.
Terawan finally gave up his work visit. "My priority is with the Commission IX. Tomorrow I will attend," said Terawan.
Deputy Chairman of Commission IX Sri Rahayu said there must be a decision that benefits all parties, aka win-win solutions. The Board agreed that Terawan could continue to carry out his responsibilities following a work visit as well as a meeting at the DPR.
As a result, the board decided that the meeting would resume today at 19.00 WIB after Terawan's work visit. This PDIP politician reminded the government to complete the data.
"Please complete the data, if the details are more comfortable. Therefore, we will continue the meeting tomorrow at exactly 19:00," Sri said.
The increase in BPJS Health contributions was officially signed after President Jokowi signed a Regulation or Perpres Number 75 of 2019 concerning Amendments to Perpres Number 82 of 2018 concerning Health Insurance on 24 October. This increase applies to all participant segments.
